chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Angelo Word was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Parenting classes, can be completed through BMCW. Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent. Comply with all BMCW orders.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
No unsupervised contact with victim, without approve of court or BMCW or Agent. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Angelo Word

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Probation Agent is in court. Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed. Discussions regarding No Contact Order. Court granted supervised contact, however the defendant may not be the sole caregiver except for 2 hours per day. The agent can modify as necessary.
At request of Defense Counsel case has been set for a Probation Review Hearing on 3/6/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23. Defense counsel and DOC notified.
Received & Filed, Letter from Defense Counsel regarding probation.

Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is in not in full compliance with conditions of probation.  Discussion regarding defendants non-compliance. Defendant advised that the court is not being taking in to custody today, but if defendant is not in full compliance by next review date he will be taken in to custody for 30 DAYS. Condition Time stayed until the next court date.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Victim Impact statements. Court reviewed and returned photographs to parties.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Parenting classes, can be completed through BMCW.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No unsupervised contact with victim, without approve of court or BMCW or Agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Comply with all BMCW orders.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
Received & Filed, Amended Information. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
AMENDED INFORMATION READS:
COUNT 1: Child Neglect (Misdemeanor), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Child Neglect (Misdemeanor), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & Letter on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Craig A Mastantuono.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Discussion as to No Contact order, court will consider modification after defendant has been adjudicated. Case set for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Due to Substitution.
Due to ADA Assignment.

Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.

Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Craig A Mastantuono.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to ADA assignment this matter is reassigned to Branch 04, Judge Flanagan.
Branch 04, Judge Flanagan is not in session today case to be heard by branch 23 for Judge Flanagan. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 04
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

04-22-14
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AM dob 1/18/14

Defendant Michael Angelo Word in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Michael Angelo Word in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
